Reviews.Title: “Clean, great price walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: CD123_12
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel. The first time was two years ago and I was less then pleased but I heard it was under new ownership and the location was so appealing. Let's be clear, it's not a luxury hotel but neither is the price. I have paid triple the amount for a dump in New York city. My last stay at the hotel was great and I'm glad I gave it another chance. Nothing fancy, the rooms are small but more then adequate, extremely clean and in a great location, for a great price. If your looking for a place in the city to stay without breaking the bank this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ArtPIII
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a 5 star hotel with impeccable service look else where. However if you want to enjoy Philly and all it has to offer and are on a bit of a budget, this a diamond in the rough. As already stated practically near everything. Rooms are a bit small, can be a bit noisy, hallways can get a lil stinky, but wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable with the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: DanAdrian
Reviews.Content: Situated right at the heart of the Historical District, this hotel with its affordable pricing really stands out for budget travelers. This hotel had experience many faces in years

Reviews.Title: “Great budget find in Center City/Society Hill”
Reviews.Author: White2tn
Reviews.Content: We arrived being less than impressed with the overall exterior presentation of the facilities (very "ho-hum") That was quickly forgotten when we discovered all the perks of this 12 room inn. 1st, excellent location. Close to the subway, numerous parks, bars, and locally owned restaurants, historical sites, visitors center, Penns Landing, etc. Just off the main drag Market Street and EASY walking distance to South Street. The staff was exceptional in meeting our needs. The room was piping hot when we arrived and they quickly reduced the temperature in the building. They also got us a fan, iron, ironing board, and glasses, at our request. The rooms were small, but very clean, no signs of any malodors or mold and mildew. The bed was a comfortable double shared with my companion. Felt more akin to staying in the guest room of a relatives home than a hotel which was fine with us. Free WiFi is always a perk, signal was nice and strong. Lastly despite being on the 3rd floor and sleeping with the window ajar (on the night New Years Eve no less) we fell asleep with no problem when we returned to our room at 3:00am :) The negatives, and for $89 (taxes & fees included) on NYE night in Philly this is REALLY nit-picking: Very small television (didn't even turn it on so who cares I don't go on vacation to watch TV, no individualized climate controls (temperature was fine in building once it was lowered), minimal bathroom counterspace (only stayed one night), no elevator (thankfully we're young and strong), no ice machine (this one was harder to adjust to but alas there is a bar downstairs where you could prolly get ice in a pinch.) Would prolly stay elsewhere if I were in town for more than two nights (or traveling with more than one person) Otherwise I would GLADLY return to this spot!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location, but a bit smelly and noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Jenvive
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel mid afternoon and check in was quick and easy, staff were polite and friendly, as they were throughout the whole stay. Our room was small but big enough, there was plenty of storage room and a clean but small bathroom. The decor was clean and modern. The location was seen, walking distance to all of the main attractions and sights. The only issues we had were noise, smell and temperature. It can be noisy on a weekend as it is right above a bar. There was also an awful smell, I suspect it was sewage from the drains outside, this lasted for the whole of our stay but there were workers around who seemed to be trying to fix the problem. The room was also cold at night, our bed was right beneath two windows and it was really drafty. We also didn't receive room service once during our stay, this wasn't a problem as we just asked when we needed clean towels etc but I expect to receive room service at least once in a 7 night stay. Despite the little issues we really enjoyed our stay here, the great location, security, free Internet and tv were great and if we returned to Philadelphia we would be sure to stay again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Margot S
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, quirky, atmospheric little hotel in the right part of town. It feels like something carved out of a 200-year-old office building, and probably is. Free wifi, and a first-rate bar/bistro downstairs that is not part of the hotel but very much joined to it physically and spiritually. I didn't notice any odd smells or noise, unlike some earlier guests. I stayed only one night but would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel with Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: briantsosie
Reviews.Content: I would recomend the society hill hotel to anyone looking for a clean room in a great area of town. The room was cozy, and very tidy. We checked in after office hours, but someone was there to personally hand me a key. The hotel went out of its way to accomodate. I would gladly stay there again and recomend it to a traveling couple/single looking for a great neighborhood/value.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location or the value at this clean and cozy hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SJF534
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July for a quick weekend getaway to see the sights of Philadelphia and we were not looking to spend a bundle on a room (we wanted to save our money for the delicious restaurants of Philadelphia!). When we got to the Society Hill Hotel we were thrilled with the location right off the bat. It is located in the heart of Old City Philadelphia- just steps away from fantastic restaurants, bars, and historic site such as Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell. When we got in our room we were pleasantly surprised and extremely pleased- the bedding was pristine and brand new and the room, while simple, was very clean and suited our needs perfectly. Overall, you can't beat this hotel for its value and location and it is clean and cute to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced flophouse”
Reviews.Author: Jessica068
Reviews.Content: For $125 a night I expect my waste basket emptied and, who knows, maybe even my bed made and the (miniscule) shower cubicle cleaned. Do not expect service or help of any kind for the duration of your stay (I was there 4 nights) - and certainly expect to get rid of your own garbage. My room was tiny (sharing even with another very small person would have been a nightmare), and the basin in the bathroom was at mid-thigh level (I am just over 5'). The shower was mediocrely clean, the towels very thin, and the room only just passed the bare foot test. There was no outside light - a window faced a high wall a couple of feet away, which dripped during the night when it rained, and smelt dank. To add insult to injury, the price I was charged on arrival was not the price on the booking form. On the plus side, the internet worked, the room had a pretty, old chair, and there was hot water. The restaurant was closed. Had it been cheaper, it would have probably seemed less abysmal. I will not be rushing back on my next visit to Philadelphia.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: morrisegan
Reviews.Content: Glad we stayed here, came to town to do some sightseeing and to see a game and stayed at the hotel. it is a small older hotel similar to ones I have stayed in when traveling in Europe but you can't go wrong especially for the price, we had clean sheets a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom, what more do you want. The rooms are small just full size beds but that worked for us. We wanted to stay in the historic district so we could walk to everything and we were right in the middle of it. After reading some of the other reviews I wasn't sure but we had nothing to complain about, the staff was nice and tried to help us out and gave us advice on restaurants, what to do and what to see. If you are looking for the chain type of hotel, its not for you but I think for under $100.00 for the night on the weekend in the city it was a great deal. The lady at the front desk said they have new management and are making improvements and upgrading the hotel. Next time we are in Philly we will come back

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: gerlachh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location for anyone trying to experience philadelphia's old city district. The hotel is minutes away from independence hall and Penns landing. It is a block off of Market street and 6 blocks from the gallery shopping center. Old city is a much more quiter, more tranquil part of the city of brotherly love. The staff was very friendly and the room was quite clean. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, and even some clubs nearby. The nightlife scene is very exciting and the best part is how many places there are and how close they were to my hotel. Currently, the hotel is renovating the restaurant upstairs which should be completed soon and I can say that the next time I'm in Philly I'm going back to the Society Hill Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ataylor047
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 3 days and on the contrary of what people say, we loved it ! Sheets were crisp and clean, girls in the office are really nice and helpful and they did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. True, the place is old but as they told me, the hotel is under new management and they slowly started renovating. Our room was little and cozy. Ben Franklin room. We had running hot water, cold water and were treated very nicely. I'd recommend this place to couples and single travelers for the simple fact that is affordable, clean and you get what you paid for your money! Thank you girls at SHH!

Reviews.Title: “Worth more like $20 a night than the $80 they are charging”
Reviews.Author: cherrybomb745
Reviews.Content: So here are the basics. They had the nerve to charge me $80 a night and there isnt even an iron in here!! - No alarm clock - No iron - Tv uses ANTENNA!!!! (yeah, like from 1966) Everytime I turn off the tv it goes back to being unprogrammable and I have to get somebody from staff to fix the antenna again - Cold, so they brought me a space heater and an extra blanket I mean, it is what it is, but I think this is worth more in the 20-30 range a night. I've stayed in Motel 6's WAYY better and cheaper than this Overall, this place sucks. I dont mind crappy hotels, but dont charge me eighty for something thats nowhere near worth that much.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge too harshly! Would defintely go back”
Reviews.Author: Julues_J
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 star hotel. It's what you get. I booked this hotel - despite the sometimes- shall we say - dodgy?!- reviews it seems to attract - because it was half the price of anything else and right around the corner from a venue we came to town to attend - The Tin Angel. It has to be said one of my friends cancelled her own booking there based solely on the bad reviews - and moved to the Best Western which we could see from our room window. When we arrived the signs - literally! - were not good! The bar downstairs - much maligned for keeping guests awake? - was closed for renovations and up on the wall was a "For Sale" sign. (we presume - for the bar!) It all looked very rundown and deserted - We eyed the Best Western with a sigh! But never fear. Rang the Hotel bell - was immediately answered by friendly lady who assured they were open for business - and she mentioned how as we had asked for an extra bed for our friend for one - night - she had set it up - IN THE LOUNGE! We have a suite?! I had emailed this request - and received no confirmation. But all was well. And a real bargain. - $20 I think extra for an extra head. We indeed had two rooms - the small double bedroom and the twice-as-big lounge area with two sofas, coffee table, tv - and well made-up extra adult cot - and a small but functional connecting bathroom (shower,sink,loo) between with Jack and Jill doors. We asked for extra towels for our friend - which were immediately provided - clean and fluffy! The rooms are indeed basic. But very clean - no bedbugs!! (mattress cover!) - the shower is hot - it's all we needed. There are broken ironing boards in cupboards and decorating tools in corners on landings - but nothing that feels unsafe or dirty and you do not come here for luxury or to hang out in your room. The corner location for bars, restaurants, clubs, shops and historical sites - is fabulous. The choice of eateries is great and yes - the streets will be NOISY!! LIVELY and BUZZING! - until 2am. - which is when the bars shut and then very shortly afterwards - all will be quiet. Don't fight it. Join them :-) They seemed to be trialling a "New!" (proclaimed the whiteboard) breakfast service. Not appealing! - There was a coffeepot and packs of cookies. But also a pretty much empty fridge with a bit of milk in it and the staffs leftover lunch! Go out instead - We found an excellent diner in Bridgets - a bracing saunter away. There are a couple of ancient computers available. I think. I never saw them on! - But you are provided with the hotel internet password - so perfect for me and my iPhone. Also good for this hotel - The Subway. The closest stop is Penns Landing/11th Street Honestly - I would stay here again - and if my favourite band hits The Hit Angel again - I most definitely will!

Reviews.Title: “Revolting - worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CuriousTraveler8048
Reviews.Content: My stay was slightly longer ago than March 2010 but was so miserable that I really want to warn others. I pre-paid for my room or would have never checked in once I saw it. - The first cab driver droped me of at another similarly named hotel run by a national chain. It looked great but wasn't the correct place. My secon cab drive then drove right past the Soceity Hill Hotel, that's how obscure and unknown it is. - I arrived in the evening, a single female, and found that there is no front desk. I had to "check in" at the adjoining corner bar but then go back outside in the rain and enter thru another door for those staying in the hotel rooms above. - Throughout the hallways, there were huge patches of dark mold on the ceiling and walls. It was filthy. - I had booked a "suite" lol, and found that it meant you enter the room through an incredibly tiny space, with a large hole in the wall. Seriously. Then you walk through the bare-bones,dated bathroom to a really small bedroom that looked like it hadn't been updated (or cleaned) in 40 years. (I didn't even undress and chose instead to sleep in my clothes on top of the bedspread.) - The bathroom had no cup or glass so in order to take an RX, I had to walk down a couple of flights of stairs, out into the rain, and into the bar to request a glass for water. Then back out onto the dark, empty street to re-enter the hotel. - I was there in Winter and it was both rainy and windy. The room's only window had a window air conditioner but there were large gaps between it and the edges of the window so that wind was actually blowing, not leaking,into my room. I took the rags that were supposed to pass as towels and stuffe them in the spaces to cut down on the chill from exterior air. I also ran the shower from time to time to generate heat to try to warm the room. - The bar was closed in the morning when I was leaving and after some effort I was unable to find a single hotel employee so there was no "check-out" and I just left. (Forgot the free breakfast that was supposed to be delivered to your door. It didn't happen but after the night I had, I wouldn't have wanted to eat anything there anyway.) That also meant no assistance getting a cab in an area where they were not frequent. I had to just start walking with my rolling suitcase and briefcase. - A few blocks later, when I did find a taxi, I started telling him about my experience and he started to laugh. According to him, the rooms above the bar were more for quick hook-ups after happy hour than overnight guests. Whatever. Yeech. - Forget getting a refund. There is no one to talk to in person or online. I could go on but hopefully this glimpse into the Hotel from Hell is adequate and you get the picture. I wouldn't stay there again if they paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: palicamus
Reviews.Content: The room they gave us was nothing like in the photos. It was small and dark. We had a private bathroom, but it was ugly and kind of dirty. They say they gave a complementary breakfast, but they don't. I stayed there two nights and never had my complementary breakfast. The hotel it's located on top of a bar, so in the night you could hear the music and the noise coming from down stairs. The good thing is the location of the place and the price. It's right next to the historical area and a subway. Another good thing was that they have free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option + great location”
Reviews.Author: booya818
Reviews.Content: Â£75 for one night which is fair enough. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Great location for shops, restaurants/bars and tourist attractions. Was concerned at the amount of exposed wires and dangerous surroundings such as a broken fire alarm. I only stayed for one night though so was not too fussed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JTraveller78
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic - right in the heart of the historic section of Philadelphia and close to heaps of great bars/restaurants - this can mean it gets a bit noisy on the weekends but I had no trouble at all sleeping with a pair of earplugs. Staff were very friendly and welcoming, as a budget option with character in a great location I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dacop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the worst hotel in wich i ever slept. ItÂ´s noisy. ItÂ´s old and there is nothing that is not broken and the beds are small. I bookt this for three days and it was hell. The internet was broken, the wireÂ´s where hangen frome the sealing and it kept goning on. There was only one nice person in the staff. There is no 24 desk so you have to do it all in the afternoon. I arrived a bit before check in time and asked about parking. Thet didnÂ´t know and gave me wrong instructions. This is not what you want when you are downtown in a unknown city with a lot of one way routes. It;s close to everytthing that's the only good thning i can think of. Close to this hotel is The Bestwestern Hotel Philladelphia on Chesnutstreet. They are good and help you. they helped us with internet. So Conclusion: Do not book!

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary conditions”
Reviews.Author: HaFord
Reviews.Content: The room smelled of cleaning products, but it was only a pipe dream. There were somebody else's PUBIC HAIRS on the bathroom floor near the shower, and somebody's head hair on one of the two pillows of the bed. I had read a few unsavory reviews about this hotel after I booked my room, and when I called (one number never has anyone answer, the other is a personal cell phone), the person guaranteed me I would get a full refund if I was not completely satisfied. Unsanitary conditions is not satisfying, and when I sent a letter with photo documentation and called, I was told there was no such guarantee. Good luck finding anyone who works there, too. This hotel ruined my stay in The City of Brotherly Love and I will never go back. You shouldn't stay here. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Flee From this Place”
Reviews.Author: kevinhippolyte
Reviews.Content: To make it short, I have two words, BEDBUGS. I booked a 3 nights stay at this dump and after the first night I ran away like a cat on fire. The place is riddled with bedbugs. The rooms are as big as closets. Condom wrappers were found in the bathroom. The cable TV didnt work. There was no elevator. I had to park at a different hotel for $20 and then walk to this one. The was no air circulation. My window veiw was to a brick wall. The shower floor was dirty. The worst living conditions I have ever been in (and I grew up in section 8 housing). The place should be condemned and burned.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the room and lack of service”
Reviews.Author: Beckysmom31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are not fussy and exacting travelers so when we had to drop off our daughter at college we thought we would give this place a try despite the mostly negative evaluations. However, sad to report, the negative evaluations are deserved. After we checked into the room, we realized that the (one and only) light over the bed was missing a lampshade and bulb. My husband went downstairs to ask for a new bulb, (because the room phone was not working!) and was told that if one could be found, it would be delivered. It never was. We expected traffic noise from the streets below, after all , the hotel is at a major intersection; however, we were not expecting garbage trucks in the middle of the night. The noise, compounded by the rather chilly temperatures, made for a poor night's rest. There were only 2 bath towels, 1 hand towel, and 1 face towel for us both. "Breakfast" was a tray set with two packages which contained a granola bar, tinned peaches, two tangerines, and 2 bottles of water. A mini coffee maker and packets of coffee and tea were also included. When I went downstairs at 8:30 to try to get a regular cup of coffee with cream, I was told by the lone person in the bar area that the coffee person was running late and that I would be able to get a cup of coffee in a half hour. At that point, my husband and I checked out .

Reviews.Title: “at home feel”
Reviews.Author: yebor9
Reviews.Content: staff was great and friendly, food is great at hotel. room is small which for me was know big deal, i was alone and the location was awesome. what a great stay lookin forward to goin back there soon. historical area and resturants all around. simple walk to all or public transportation

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rcarr124
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent the night here at Society Hill Hotel in Oct. 2009 - we couldnt have been treated any better.......immediately when you walk in you feel the old feel of Philadelphia, friendly face behind the bar and lots of atmosphere! We were immediately taken to our room, showed around and given our key. We decided to eat at the bar - I got the Philly steak and cheese, my daughter got the french dip and we shared a WONDERFUL slice of dessert! The best meal for a very good price, we left very happy. We were in walking distance of everything and when we came back, we slept like babies! Our room was clean, the bathroom spotless, the bedding smelled fresh......I would highly recommend this hotel for others. Our room was small, but just perfect for two. We would definately stay again. Sharon was very sweet to us and we didnt need a thing. Breakfast was more than I expected. Very good coffee, juice, fruit, bagels, cereal.... very nice for a continental breakfast, served on a nice tray, pretty plates and able to bring it back to your room. I wish we were back there now!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: theglobetrotter1970
Reviews.Content: Great Location I was close to everything, like the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall. "Really Cool" bar and restaurant downstairs. And I must say the staff was helpful with directions and generally very friendly. I would recommend it if you are looking to hang out in Philadelphia for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: AguasH
Reviews.Content: Well after reading all the negative reviews I was preparing myself for a horrible experience but only needing a place to sleep I decided to book the room and take my chances. No front desk but most bed and breakfast don't have them anyway, checked in at that bar. The man at the bar was very friendly and helpful. Walking into the hotel, the slight smell of cigarettes were in the air. As I walked to the room I was ready to see mice and dirty sheets but none of them were there. The bed was neatly made and the sheets were clean, I lifted the bed up to check for mice but nothing, checked the closet and nothing. I did find an iron and ironing board in the closet though along with extra bedding. I did get the cheapest smallest room so I wasn't expecting much, first off the TV was TINY! To me this didn't matter, I barely watch TV at home as it is. The room was quite cold, it seemed as if the heat wasn't turned on, not a good thing when the temp outside was a brisk 45 degrees. The bathroom was quite small, and it was not shared with another room as someone else mentioned in an earlier review. Shower was tiny, the sink was also small. There were clean towels and 2 rolls of toilet paper in the bathroom. Overall I would rate this hotel a 3.5 out of 5,its definitely worth the price, there is a best western about a block away that was charging $200 per night! Save you cash and stay at this place its nothing like everyone seems to make, now if your traveling with kids this place isn't for you, singles and couples looking for a place to stay at for the night stay here and save some cash. Breakfast was delivered promptly, not the best breakfast but it did the job to hold you up till a snack later on during the morning. Now the few issues I had:no cups, no soap, no ice machine or even a fridge. And did I mention it was COLD!!!! Very small rooms but overall I would recommend this hotel for an overnight trip or a short stay in the Philadelphia area. I did take pictures from almost every angle of the room, i will post them tomorrow for everyone to see.

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: angelared
Reviews.Content: Arrived late afternoon, to be greeted by a grumpy tattooed barman, who muttered his first - and last - words to us. Not a warm welcome at all. The hotel absolutely stinks. Kind of damp/boilled cabbage/rotting trash smell. Our room was in keeping with the whole of the hotel - filthy!! Was unable to get a room elsewhere, so had a miserable 3 nights in the very worst hotel room I have ever stayed in. I am not normally the type of person to grumble ;I am of the opinion that when on holiday, get out and see things - a hotel is only a base after all -but this place very nearly ruined my holiday. I was afraid to use the shower, it was so dirty. The bathroom is so tiny you need to stand in the shower in order to use the basin! The bed linen was stained and dingy. Walls and woodwork were dirty, faded and damp. At the end of a very tiring day touring , my husband and I sat half asleep on a bench dreading our return to this flea pit! At no point was any staff approachable - the tattoed ignoramus behind the bar was permanently on the phone chatting to his chums about get rich quick schemes and ripping off tourists! It really is a shame that no-one has taken the time to clean this place up; it is in an excellent location, with a (currently very dirty) bar which serves food. It would have been so much better to be able to want to sleep here, and maybe even have a drink in the bar before turning in for the night. My only regret beside booking into this place is that I did not read previous reviews on this site. Please, do not waste your money - it truly is filthy, unwelcoming and not worth any amount of saving.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: mike19511
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I had my reserved my opion until I had stayed here. Each room has a name of a famous person associated with it and we stayed in the William Penn room. We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor that shared the bathroom. The shower was great for a hotel of any kind and although we did not see any mice, it is obvious why there were mouse traps in the closets. If you leave your windows open mice could get into a room by crawling up the outside walls. All rooms that we saw had new berber carpeting and we had cable tv and free wireless for our laptop. There was a lot of noise on the street from celebrations of the Phillies winning the game late at night and perhaps we should have had a room without windows on the inside wall so we would not be kept awake. Our room had air conditioning that worked. We were served continental breakfast each day at the time we specified that consisted of fresh fruit, bagels, coffee and fresh orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: sirwashington
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, and that's what you pay for. The service is non existent, and if you don't want to be bothered or bother anybody it's perfect. Amenities are also little to none, although breakfast brought to the room was a nice try at service. Great for young travelers who don't need much in a hotel and are ok with mediocre services. oh, and check in was with the bar tender in the restaurant downstairs, and there is no reception. Said bar downstairs and bus line outside and general partyers cause noise into the night, which is ok if you can sleep through it because the window in our room was jammed OPEN!

Reviews.Title: “The Good...The Bad...And The Ugly!”
Reviews.Author: kazooboys
Reviews.Content: First, the GOOD. Location, location, location, breakfast delivered to your room and the restaurtant downstairs. Next, the BAD. The key we were given not only opened our room, but every room in the hotel. Not a good thing if you ask me. And lastly, the UGLY. We stayed in room 205 which is directly above the entrance to the restaurant and on the corner of an intersection with a stop light. When the bars closed at 2am people moved outside and the noise kept us awake until 4am when police cars blocked the street and people started to go home. It seems that every car that stopped at the light had its windows open and very loud music playing. This is hardly a four star property...but it really could be charming if someone put some money into it. New soundproof windows would help, along with an extreme makeover. Would I stay here again? Definitely not. It just happened that we were there the weekend of Penn State's graduation and everything else was booked.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't enjoy sharing my room with a mouse”
Reviews.Author: citysqaure
Reviews.Content: I found it to be absolutely horrid. The room was so old and dingey; all the curtains were stained and dusty and the bed was really uncomfortable (you could feel the springs) and the quilt and blanket was also stained and dingey. There were hairs I kept finding in my bathroom that I know weren't mine; the room just had an overall unclean feel to it. On my second night I encountered a mouse in my room and was so thankful I was checking out in the morning. I felt so icky after leaving I kept imagining that I had things crawling on me. I don't think I did, but it was just an unpleasant two nights; totally wouldn't return even for that bargain rate they charge. The velvet winged back chair in the room was also stained and filthy; I couldn't have imagined even putting something down on it, let alone sitting in it. and relaxing. I understand the new manager has plans to renovate but in the meantime its a no go zone as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: “New Management A Plus for the Society Hill Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrKing47
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before because the location was what I needed and the price was right. But now the owner of the restaurant on the first floor is managing the hotel and everything has come together as a pleasant surprise. Now there is always somone there to help with any questions or problems - well at least until about 2:00 AM, and you shouldn't be up after that anyway. Basic lodging complete with continental breakfast to you room. Bar and restaurant is super. Two room suite is worth the extra few dollars - still less than one room at places nearby. Walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at this place!”
Reviews.Author: edmole1
Reviews.Content: Don't be wooed by the low price and good location; this place is a real dive. The first tipoff should have been when we were waiting to "check in" and the exterminator arrived. Not a good sign. The hotel reminded me of a poorly maintained off-campus apartment rented to college students. It had badly stained, warped ceiling tiles, blistering, peeling plaster walls, stained carpets and filthy windows--and that's just in the hallways. Access to the fire escape was impeded by a couple of day beds stashed in a corridor, and a smoke detector in the hallway was beeping constantly--dead battery perhaps? The room also had blistering plaster, a nonfunctioning toilet with no TP, what appeared to be vomit stains on the carpet, a TV set the size of a toaster oven and a tiny double (non-Queen) bed crammed into a small space. The heater vent was nearly inaccessible near the ceiling, the closet was unpainted, and the room had a generally unpleasant smell. There was no hotel manager on duty (at 5 p.m.!), so we had to turn in our key to the restaurant manager before fleeing to another hotel. I would not recommend Society Hill to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location - and quait!”
Reviews.Author: laroth
Reviews.Content: I wonder if society hill hotel has changed ownership since the other postings. My experience was just delightful. Close to everything in historic old city, and close any means of transportation to other neighborhoods. the room was just fine for a locally owned b&b, and kind of charming. the bar and resturant was a relaxed place to unwind after site seeing. great beer, great food, excellent and personable service. all and all, a great home base for a philadelphia adventure!

Reviews.Title: “The little hotel that couldn't...”
Reviews.Author: palad0r0
Reviews.Content: The signs were all there... bad reviews, the mystery phone number... but when I arrived it became crystal clear that if any health inspector went to the Society Hill Hotel, it would surely be closed. The location is great, but that they charge as much as they do for accommodations that are worse than dodgy hostels is absolutely unbelievable. As the other reviewers explained, the dirty carpets are just the beginning! I didn't encounter rodents, but I also tried to spend as little time as possible in the place and slept with the lights on and didn't unpack my clothes for fear of taking something with me that might not have been there when I first arrived. The place has potential, so it's very sad that it's in such disrepair with leaks, nonworking light bulbs, and worse! Fortunately the person whom I could reach by phone was nice enough to let me out of my multi-night reservation, but I really think I should've gotten my money back for that night. Can anyone save the Society Hill Hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jewels737
Reviews.Content: Sure, the room was TINY. We booked the smallest room they had...it was inexpensive, right in the heart of Old City, and it was only a weekend trip. I read reviews about mice, and how small it was, but booked it anyway. My boyfriend and I both thought it was cute...the ceilings were high, so it made it feel much less cramped. It was very old fashioned and relatively quiet considering all the noise on the streets below. The bar downstairs had good food and an excellent (though small) selection of beer. The location is definitely fantastic--only a few blocks away from South Street. Around 5 in the morning on our first night, the air conditioner starting spitting out chunks of ice...not a big deal, we turned it down and went back to sleep. They served a nice little breakfast in the morning, too. If ever I needed to stay overnight in Philly again, I'd definitely come here.

Reviews.Title: “en episode of the Twilight Zone”
Reviews.Author: jwalke21
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. Let's see... I'l recap some highlights of my visit sung to 'Partidge in a Pear Tree: "One AWOL manager, two smelly towels, three rustling mice, four carpet stains, Five ....more ....rustling ....mice..." 'Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Thank Gawd we have a sense of humor!”
Reviews.Author: soulchicken
Reviews.Content: This one turned out to be a doosey! We often take chances on old inns or hotels as we enjoy the historic rustic feel and are often times pleasantly surprised...but not this time. The amenities advertised must be from another decade as there were no fresh flowers or drinks, nor most of the other things listed. We can handle just about anything for a night or two, but this place was pretty laughable. The outside was quaint with the old wooden pub style windows, (dirty) green awnings and umbrella covered sidewalk seating, but that is where "quaint" ended. We accepted the four story walkup as advertised, but it was quite steep and would be tough on some. The stairways and hallways are narrow and cluttered with a very odd assortment of "stuff" covered in a nice thick layer of dust in which it was hard to keep from writing our names in. The ceiling tiles were stained, warped with some caving in. Small rooms are not a problem for us, but it was hard to feel comfortable in a room that had been so utterly neglected. The carpet had stains, the mouldings contained a nice layer of dust and dirt, and the mice left their calling cards each night on the couch, table and floor. The toilet paper holder had been ripped off the wall, the toilet lid fell off each time it was raised and the shower tile and surrounding drywall were crustily swollen. The shower barely drained, so even the shortest shower left you standing in two inches of soapy water. After lifting the corner of the dirty scrap of carpet in front of the shower, we found a nice hole through the floor, as well as a huge open hole in the wall of the closet. As we tried to open the window, it fell off in our hands and took some creative thinking to replace. Although breakfast was delivered on time (sort of), it was hard to enjoy canned fruit cocktail and a tough croissant. There was no front desk or anyone to contact at all except the helpless bartender at the restaurant below. The condition of this place is truly a shame as it has so much potential and a fantastic location. It seems obvious that the owner has little interest in maintaining the place. We had a great time in Philadelphia, but wouldn't stay here again no matter what the price.

Reviews.Title: “They need an exterminator”
Reviews.Author: bennyboy96
Reviews.Content: It didn't bother me much that you check it with the tatooed sleeveless bartender downstairs. Walking upstairs you realize you're in an old building that hasn't been kept up...stains on the carpets, holes in the walls and windows, etc. The room I initially had had a large hole in the wall...about 2 feet in diameter. After mentioning the hole to the bartender, he called the hotel manager so I could talk to him. I told him about the hole and he asked me if it was really a big deal and that nobody else ever had a problem with the hole and they were booked up. I told him it wasn't a huge deal, but i was disappointed and asked him if there was anything he could do...discount, couple of drinks at the bar, etc. He said he'd think about it and be in the bar a few hours later. When we went back to the room, we actually saw a mouse running around the room...granted we had food on the floor in a plastic bag, but didn't expect mice running around the room. A few hours later the manager somehow ended up finding a room available and we moved to another room that didn't have a hole in the wall or mice...or so we thought. We were initially pretty happy with the 2nd room (no hole, no mice so far) considering we only paid $105 for the night. Everything else available was over $200. We moved the bag of food onto a table 4 feet off the ground. In the middle of the night, we awoke to the sound of the plastic bag rustling around...yep, more mice in the food! I put the bag of food outside the door and the rest of the night was fine. The location is excellent, and it's hard to complain about a budget hotel, however mice in the room is where we draw the line. The hotel is rated 3 stars and it should be 2 stars max. If you are on a budget and want to stay in the best location, aren't expecting much, and don't bring food in the room, and are only staying 1-2 nights, then this place is OK. Otherwise, look elsewhere and consider paying more for a critter-less hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like flop houses....”
Reviews.Author: scroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy sleeping in your car then you might enjoy this hotel. The main problem is the management and lack of attention to what could be a nice place to stay. Right now there are some serious problems. There is a big hole in the wall of my room and the dead bolt hole is gouged out making it difficult to lock the door. The cable TV doesn't work (although the manager said I should disconnect the cable and connect it directly to the TV and I would get "even more" channels). There was a chewed energy bar on the table in the morning, a chewed corner of my luggage where I stored my Raisin Bran and mouse droppings on the table. On the bright side, the maid cleaned the table after I left a note requesting it. The air conditioning is very weak and there is quite a bit of dust in the halls and in my room. No cups for water and a couple of the lights did not work. The telephone did not work on the third night of my stay. A somewhat surly waiter in the bar directly below the hotel called the manager and would not let me talk directly to the manager. I was informed that the problem with the phone had to do with the power company. When I called the manager directly about three minutes later I got voice mail. Two numbers in the hotel directory that are for customer service are incorrect or in-op. I really would not recommend this hotel to anyone, regardless of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bostongirl_MA
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Looking at the reviews, I expected the place to be small and equipped with just the basic amenities, but I never expected this. My room was extremely small (8x10) with walk through bathroom to get to the adjoining "living room" area on the other side. All furnishings were really old and dirty- probably what you'd expect to get paying $40-$40/night, not $130/night like I did. There is no lobby (you obtain the key by checking in with the restaurant downstairs, and enter through a side door on 3rd street), and nobody ever answered the office number when I tried to inquire about breakfast. You check out by dropping the key into a slot on the 2nd floor. Nonetheless, you check off what you want for breakfast and leave the sign on the doorknob, and you get a really basic breakfast delivered to you at your specified time. The shower was disgusting. Basically the type of place you close your eyes so you don't see the grime. Overall- the place didn't feel clean at all, was extremely small, and difficult to get a good night's rest given all the above. In a decent location, however, and walkable to most major attractions. Walking to the convention center area takes about 20 minutes when you walk briskly. Many upscale and trendy restaurants nearby. Not even a decent place to sleep, if you're the type that wants just a basic hotel just for that, thus AVOID this place at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!! Please read”
Reviews.Author: allisonlindsey
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the room which was about 85 degrees (the window was nailed closed so we couldnt open it for air) and seeing the stained carpet, cracked lamp shade, disgusting shower and a handwritten note taped to the bathroom wall that read "under construction" where the toilet paper holder should have been, we decided to accept our losses and find another hotel. When I told the bartender/"front desk attendant" that we just couldnt stay there he said, "Dont worry about it. It happens all the time. We'll refund your money straight away". At least customer service was decent.

Reviews.Title: “suited my needs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came to Philadelphia for a conference. It was my first time here with limited time for sightseeing. I picked Society Hill for several reasons...location, price and food. The location puts you within blocks of everything historic and only 10 blocks to Chinatown. The restaraunt (on the first floor) is wonderful. Nice atmosphere, great food. The price of the hotel room reflects what you are offered. The rooms are small..mine is about 8 X 10. However, I have a private bathroom, closet, table, double bed and TV. The decor...think comfy dorm room. Since I came here for work and sightseeing I'm happy. I don't want to pay a lot for a room I won't ever see except to sleep. This is not a "service hotel". There is no front desk. You will be given a key to the private entrance door and you come and go as you please. It's like borrowing a good friends room. The building is old...so no elevator. I didn't rent a car, but can walk nearly everywhere. Cabs are plentiful. Just step to the curb and within minutes you have one. It's about $5 to get to the convention center. The noise is like living in an apt in the city. I'm not too disturbed by traffic etc. PROS: Internet (all of Old City Philly has wireless access...a city initiative). Great location. Good food. Comfortable bed. The money saved can be spent on the outstanding things to do around the city. Cons: No fresh flowers (I don't mind, but it was advertised). If you want to be spoiled with space, 500 thread count sheets and treated like a queen...you aren't going to get it here. (But then, that isn't the type of place it is trying to be).

Reviews.Title: “Society Hill Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a fairly discriminating hotel-goer I have to admit that I was completely unprepared for this tiny 3 story walk-up hotel; especially not when the bartender from the restaurant below was the one to give me the room's key. And although my initial reaction was to concoct a reason to leave, I think the hotel served its purpose for my quick Philly stay and it could for you too. Things worth mentioning....room more like a walk-in closet, .........awesome shower water pressure only countered by the fact that it stops for flushing toilets. Also be prepared for early morning convo's with the Philly pigeons, and don't be alarmed by the noises of your neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This could have been a great B and B near the Liberty Bell in historic Philly. Instead, it was among the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. The owner/operator rarely answers the phones, the 'renovation'consists of slapping on coats of paint, the furniture was so old and lumpy that it could not be comfortably sat on, the carpet had a 6 inch stain on it, everything was dingy, incredibly noisy from street noises and thin air cond. partitions, the bfast consisted of a stale croissant and a half glass of OJ and some coffee (the promised grapefruit never came), towels were frayed, no kleenex or even a glass in the room. I could go on and on. The only positives were a small but comfortable bed (although the street noise negated that comfort), and the owner doesnt encrypt his WiFi so there is wireless internet. Very good restaurant below but a different owner. Most rooms tiny. Really tiny. What a dump! Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “A Microbiologist's Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Philadelphia, for which we had reservations at the Society Hill Hotel. Based on the hotel's website, and the menu of the accompanying restaurant, we decided that the motel would indeed meet the description of being "old, yet charming". Unfortunately, it is only the "old" part of that description which is appropriate. The rooms are ultra small, and ours had baby blue paint throughout. The furniture was early Salvation Army, and at least two hairs, not belonging to us, were found in our short stay. In saying short, I am not exagerrating. Upon entering our room, we were overwhelmed with a mold and mildew odor. We opened the windows, believing it might air out, and then went out for some Cokes. On return, we realized it was not any better, and, after about 30 minutes, we decided we absolutely could not stay the night in such conditions. Having intense allergies to mold, I began to feel the effect in a short time. I realized a night in such a room would make me deathly ill. We went down to the bar and told the attendant (the motel owner is nowhere to be found) of our dilemma. She seemed not the least bit surprised, and recommended another hotel in the area. (We ended up a the Penn's View which was pure luxury in comparison.) It seems to me that only a microbiologist, or someone who enjoys the smell of a damp basement, would enjoy a stay at the Society Hill Hotel. Avoid this place like the plague....or you may end up feeling like you have contracted one.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I expected a cute B&B and it reminded me of a musty college dorm. The windows were paper-thin, the hall smelled terrible and the sheets and shower were dirty. Not worth the $.

Reviews.Title: “Highly un-recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This ever so nicely described bed and breakfast was nothing like the online description. All of the things that made me choose to stay here were either extremely exaggerated or just plain not there. No fresh flowers or fruit, no free drink at the bar, the 'fresh' breakfast consisted of canned fruit cocktail, warm juice, and a little debbie wrapped coffee cake which was delivered hours before our specified delivery time. The room was hot as could be, and the bed was just terrible. The owner/manager apologized profusely, but did nothing to compensate us for our awful stay. For the price (over $100 a night) you'd do better sleeping out in your car at a parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bar/restaurant has re-opened, and it is exceptional. I am writing this review from room 203 of the hotel. The rooms are small, and the hotel service is decidely part-time, as per a bed and breakfast, but there is nothing so decadent as being able to enjoy the Liberty Bell, Independence Hall, and the other sites of Philidelphia, and then walk a block or two to your hotel, enjoy an incredible meal, then just walk upstairs to your room. Then maybe walk back downstairs for a few more drinks. The new bar/restaurant is owned by Chris Conover. He's been a waiter in Phily for 20 years in the top restaurants in the city, and now he's opened one of his own. Along with it, he brought in the best chefs, waiters, and recipies he found from his 20 years and brought them all together. You won't find Coors Light on tap here. Instead, he pours the best beer of each style (light, amber, dark, etc) that he's ever had and put them all on tap. The food is the same way. The menu changes slightly every day, and more radically each month. Ask Chris to add Chicken fingers to the menu just to see his reaction! Truly, the food is out of this world. And, they serve it as it comes out. So, while everyone might not get their meals at exactly the same time, each meal will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this place was the location - only 2 blocks from main attractions. The rest was very disappointing. When we drove up, we said "This can't be it". Unfortunately, it was. The restaurant down below (closed temporarily - with windows covered in newspaper), the construction going on next door and across the street, and the dingy appearance all were turn-offs right away! Inside, there was a cheerful proprietor (however, you could never find him when you needed him after that). We had to climb 3 flights of stairs(no elevator) to a tiny, not-so-well kept room. It was not quaint; just old. There were no fresh flowers as advertised, and the guy in charge had no idea about internet connections which also were advertised. The breakfast too was a disappointment. One muffin and canned fruit cocktail. At $110, it was a real rip-off. We're not difficult to please, but this definitely was not a place we'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This b&b has superb location and met expectations. Although the attached restaurant was unexpectedly closed, there are many great restaurants located in the block around the hotel. In European fashion, the hotel has no elevator. The steps are steep so don't choose a room on an upper floor if you are not in good physical shape. I would certainly stay at Society Hill again.

HotelInfo.Name: Society Hill Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 301 Chestnut Street, Philadelphia, PA 19106
